1.text: The wicked flee when no man pursueth; But the righteous are secure as a young lion.

2.text: For the transgression of a land many are the princes thereof; But by a man of understanding and knowledge established order shall long continue.

3.text: A poor man that oppresseth the weak Is like a sweeping rain which leaveth no food.

4.text: They that forsake the law praise the wicked; But such as keep the law contend with them.

5.text: Evil men understand not justice; But they that seek the LORD understand all things.

6.text: Better is the poor that walketh in his integrity, Than he that is perverse in his ways, though he be rich.

7.text: A wise son observeth the teaching; but he that is a companion of gluttonous men shameth his father.

8.text: He that augmenteth his substance by interest and increase, Gathereth it for him that is gracious to the poor.

9.text: He that turneth away his ear from hearing the law, Even his prayer is an abomination.

10.text: Whoso causeth the upright to go astray in an evil way, He shall fall himself into his own pit; But the whole-hearted shall inherit good.

11.text: The rich man is wise in his own eyes; But the poor that hath understanding searcheth him through.

12.text: When the righteous exult, there is great glory; But when the wicked rise, men must be sought for.

13.text: He that covereth his transgressions shall not prosper; But whoso confesseth and forsaketh them shall obtain mercy.

14.text: Happy is the man that feareth alway; But he that hardeneth his heart shall fall into evil.

15.text: As a roaring lion, and a ravenous bear; So is a wicked ruler over a poor people.

16.text: The prince that lacketh understanding is also a great oppressor; But he that hateth covetousness shall prolong his days.

17.text: A man that is laden with the blood of any person Shall hasten his steps unto the pit; none will support him.

18.text: Whoso walketh uprightly shall be saved; But he that is perverse in his ways shall fall at once.

19.text: He that tilleth his ground shall have plenty of bread; But he that followeth after vain things shall have poverty enough.

20.text: A faithful man shall abound with blessings; But he that maketh haste to be rich shall not be unpunished.

21.text: To have respect of persons is not good; For a man will transgress for a piece of bread.

22.text: He that hath an evil eye hasteneth after riches, And knoweth not that want shall come upon him.

23.text: He that rebuketh a man shall in the end find more favour Than he that flattereth with the tongue.

24.text: Whoso robbeth his father or his mother, and saith: ‘It is no transgression’, The same is the companion of a destroyer.

25.text: He that is of a greedy spirit stirreth up strife; But he that putteth his trust in the LORD shall be abundantly gratified.

26.text: He that trusteth in his own heart is a fool; But whoso walketh wisely, he shall escape.

27.text: He that giveth unto the poor shall not lack; But he that hideth his eyes shall have many a curse.

28.text: When the wicked rise, men hide themselves; But when they perish, the righteous increase.
